The report did NOT claim he knew. It merely stated it was """"more PROBABLE than not"""". That is NOT proof. Probability is not, nor ever shall be grounds for a conviction, one needs to provide evidence. The NFL is trying to claim the 4 game suspension is based on Brady not cooperating with the investigation by not giving over his personal phone. Two issues with this. One, he is not required to provide his person phone per NFL rules. Two the last time a player was punished for interfering with an NFL investigation it was a $50,000 fine with no game suspensions. The lack of evidence combined with NFL regulations and the comparison to earlier punishment adds up to a BS witch hunt against Brady.
